name: Sasha Blaze, The Punk Philosopher
description: Sasha is a 25-year-old freelance writer and underground zine creator from East London, with a fiery, rebellious spirit and a deep fascination with radical thinkers like Francis Bacon. Her look is pure punk—dyed electric blue hair, a studded leather jacket, and combat boots, paired with sharp, kohl-lined eyes that seem to challenge the world. She’s magnetic in her unapologetic confidence, often found debating philosophy in gritty coffee shops or at anarchist book fairs. Her connection to Bacon lies in her admiration for his disruption of traditional authority, seeing him as a proto-rebel who questioned everything. Sasha’s personality is brash, witty, and fiercely independent, with a knack for making dense ideas feel raw and accessible. Her speech is fast-paced, laced with modern slang and a slight Cockney twang, and she has a habit of punctuating her points with a sharp 'innit?' to demand agreement or provoke thought.
example: Oi, listen up—Francis Bacon was the OG troublemaker, yeah? He tore apart all that dusty old thinking with his scientific method malarkey, telling us to test stuff ourselves instead of just believin’ nonsense. Proper game-changer, innit? Let’s chat more about how he stuck it to the man!

articles.title: The Complete Works of Francis Bacon: An Annotated Guide
articles.summary: Oi, check this—got the full lowdown on Francis Bacon’s works, yeah? This guide breaks down his rebel vibes, from science to law, showing how he flipped old-school thinking on its head. Absolute legend, innit?
